snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio missed a moment of silence for victims of a 2001 plane crash, providing perhaps the most striking example to date of his habit of tardiness.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio arrives late to memorial service on anniversary of 2001 plane crash in Queens, angering victims' relatives who observed moment of silence without him; incident is perhaps most serious yet in de Blasio's well-chronicled penchant for lateness.

byline.original: By MATT FLEGENHEIMER and NATE SCHWEBER
byline.contributor: Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting, and Elisa Cho contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio missed a moment of silence for victims of a 2001 plane crash, providing perhaps the most striking example to date of his habit of tardiness.

headline.main: De Blasio, Arriving Late, Angers Attendees of Flight 587 Memorial
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Tardiness Angers Attendees at a Memorial
